note.p: Birth: Burnfoot, in the parish of Westerkirk, Dumfriesshire, Scotland (02 May 1769)
Death: His lodgings in Prince's Street, Hanover Square, London (30 April 1833)

Career: Entered service with the HEIC (1782); Persian instructor to the Nizam of the Deccan (1792); Secretary to the Commander in Chief in India; Envoy to Persia (1799-1801); Political secretary to General Wellesley (FRS 1847) during the Mahratta War (1803-1804); published his 'Political History of India' (1811); returned to Britain and undertook literary work (1822); Governor of Bombay (1826-1830); MP for Launceston (1831-2)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1832-1833 No 14 pp 224-226
Notes: Statue by Chantrey in Westminster Abbey
